text: As a member of WVCDL, I‚Äôll be at the capitol tomorrow joining them in lobbying legislators to protect our 2nd Amendment freedoms. If you can, join us. There is strength in numbers. We must remain vigilant.On Monday, February 17 at 8AM, the WVCDL will be at the WV State Capitol once again for our lobby day. There are some important things to know if you are new.  This event is NOT a protest. This is our annual day to talk with legislators in person. We are always polite and respectful. The WVCDL Board of Directors has a zero-tolerance policy for arguing or being rude to legislators or staff. That is not what we are there to do.  We are 100% non-partisan. We enjoy bipartisan support on all of our legislation. Never judge a politician by the letter after their name.  The WV State Capitol complex is a legislated gun-free zone with the exception that firearms may be left out of sight in your locked vehicle.  In the galleries (where we sit to watch the floor session of the House or Senate), there is no flash photography, hats must be removed, there is no yelling/booing/cheering. The only clapping is at the beginning during introductions. There is no food/drink allowed. If a doorman asks you to correct something, please do so.  We have an excellent reputation at the Capitol and are well known for being professional at all times. Lobby day is a great event and we look forward to seeing you on Monday morning!  Amber Perry, WVCDL V.P. & Lobbyist

We need to talk about this new #guncontrol bill, s.2690, the "RESPONSE Act," co-sponsored by Shelley Moore Capito.  The "RESPONSE Act" punishes ‚Äúunlicensed‚Äù firearms dealers in order to ensure private gun sales go through a NICS background check, even though states who have implemented universal background checks have a 15% higher per capita rate of mass shooting deaths. This basically creates a ‚Äúnationwide task force‚Äù designed to spy on and punish law-abiding gun owners who build and sell their own firearms. Do law-abiding Americans really need their names on another deep-state watch list? Furthermore, parts of the bill provide encouragement for social media platforms and users to report individuals they think might pose a threat to themselves or others, making already existing Gun Confiscation (Red flag) laws even more easily abused. Even when no crime has been committed, this bill allows for putting private citizens on watch lists and taking their lawfully owned property away.  Furthermore, there's a serious concern about the privacy of children under this legislation. Individuals on the left and right are concerned about government surveillance of children, and there's no evidence that this will mitigate the problem of school shootings.  The "Response Act" is a bill co-sponsored by 6 Republican senators. 5 of them are up for reelection in 2020, including my opponent. I urge you to call their offices and make your voices heard. #WhittforWV

source: Allen Whitt for U.S. Senate,Tom Roten
text: Thanks for spreading the word, Tom!Did you hear? Allen Whitt announced this morning on the show he's running for US Senate in 2020!

Conservative leader Allen Whitt has announced his candidacy for the United States Senate. He will be challenging sitting incumbent Shelley Moore Capito for the Republican nomination. A former writer and spokesperson for Dr. Billy Graham, Allen Whitt has served for the past six years as the President of the West Virginia Family Policy Council. In that role, he has had a long record of defending West Virginians‚Äô first amendment rights. He has also been a tireless advocate of the right to life. Over the past half-decade, Allen has been one of the most prominent conservative voices in the Mountain State, consistently championing conservative values and vetting Republican candidates for the West Virginia Republican Party. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm running to bring West Virginia values to Washington,‚Äù Allen says. ‚ÄúAs a Republican, I campaigned for Shelley Moore Capito in 2014, but conservatives have been let down too many times by her votes and her statements. Her most recent comments on supporting red flag laws simply don‚Äôt represent the views of the majority of West Virginians.‚Äù For more about how you can get involved in our campaign visit our website: www.whittforwv.com.

The House Impeachment hearings are a sham. A better question would be asking why the children of high-level Democrats have contracts with Ukrainian oil and gas companies?

We need to talk about this new #guncontrol bill, s.2690, the "RESPONSE Act," co-sponsored by Shelley Moore Capito.  The "RESPONSE Act" punishes ‚Äúunlicensed‚Äù firearms dealers in order to ensure private gun sales go through a NICS background check, even though states who have implemented universal background checks have a 15% higher per capita rate of mass shooting deaths. This basically creates a ‚Äúnationwide task force‚Äù designed to spy on and punish law-abiding gun owners who build and sell their own firearms. Do law-abiding Americans really need their names on another deep-state watch list? Furthermore, parts of the bill provide encouragement for social media platforms and users to report individuals they think might pose a threat to themselves or others, making already existing Gun Confiscation (Red flag) laws even more easily abused. Even when no crime has been committed, this bill allows for putting private citizens on watch lists and taking their lawfully owned property away.  Furthermore, there's a serious concern about the privacy of children under this legislation. Individuals on the left and right are concerned about government surveillance of children, and there's no evidence that this will mitigate the problem of school shootings.  The "Response Act" is a bill co-sponsored by 6 Republican senators. 5 of them are up for reelection in 2020, including my opponent. I urge you to call their offices and make your voices heard. #WhittforWV

Left-leaning GOP Senators like Shelley Moore Capito oppose Cuccinelli because they ultimately oppose Trump on immigration. But the American people are serious about our immigration crisis--more serious than many of our representatives. I'm serious too. #Whitt4WV
